questions.text: If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 4$$, then find the value of $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}$$
If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 3$$, then find the value of $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}$$
If $$x - \frac{1}{x} = 5$$, then find the value of $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}$$
If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = \sqrt{20}$$, then find the value of $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}$$
If $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2} = 14$$, then find the value of $$x + \frac{1}{x}$$
questions.solution:
Given $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2} = 14$$
Add 2 to both sides to complete the square:
$$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2} + 2 = 14 + 2$$
$$(x + \frac{1}{x})^2 = 16$$
$$x + \frac{1}{x} = \sqrt{16} = 4$$

questions.text: If $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2} = 79$$, then find the value of $$x + \frac{1}{x}$$
If $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2} = 51$$, then find the value of $$x - \frac{1}{x}$$
If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 3$$, then find the value of $$x^4 + \frac{1}{x^4}$$
questions.solution:
Step 1: Find $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}$$
$$3^2 - 2 = 7$$
Step 2: Find $$x^4 + \frac{1}{x^4}$$ using the result from Step 1
$$7^2 - 2 = 49 - 2 = 47$$

questions.text: If $$x - \frac{1}{x} = 4$$, then find the value of $$x^4 + \frac{1}{x^4}$$
questions.solution:
Step 1: Find $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}$$
$$4^2 + 2 = 18$$
Step 2: Find $$x^4 + \frac{1}{x^4}$$ using the result from Step 1
$$18^2 - 2 = 324 - 2 = 322$$

questions.text: If $$\sqrt{x} + \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} = 3$$, then find the value of $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}$$
questions.solution:
Step 1: Squaring given equation gives $$x + \frac{1}{x}$$
$$3^2 - 2 = 7$$
Step 2: Squaring again gives $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}$$
$$7^2 - 2 = 47$$

questions.text: If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 3$$, then find the value of $$x^3 + \frac{1}{x^3}$$
If $$x - \frac{1}{x} = 4$$, then find the value of $$x^3 - \frac{1}{x^3}$$
If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 5$$, then find the value of $$x^3 + \frac{1}{x^3}$$
If $$x - \frac{1}{x} = 6$$, then find the value of $$x^3 - \frac{1}{x^3}$$
If $$x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2} = 23$$, then find the value of $$x^3 + \frac{1}{x^3}$$
If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 3$$, then find the value of $$x^5 + \frac{1}{x^5}$$
If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 4$$, then find the value of $$x^5 + \frac{1}{x^5}$$
If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 3$$, then find the value of $$x^6 + \frac{1}{x^6}$$
questions.solution:
This can be seen as squaring the cubic term:
$$x^3 + \frac{1}{x^3} = 18$$
$$x^6 + \frac{1}{x^6} = (18)^2 - 2 = 324 - 2 = 322$$

questions.text: If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = \sqrt{3}$$, then find the value of $$x^6$$
questions.solution:
If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = \sqrt{3}$$, then cubing both sides gives $$x^3 + \frac{1}{x^3} = 0$$
$$\implies x^6 + 1 = 0$$
$$\implies x^6 = -1$$

questions.text: If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 1$$, then find the value of $$x^3$$
questions.solution:
If $$x + \frac{1}{x} = 1$$, then $$x^2 - x + 1 = 0$$
Multiply both sides by $$(x + 1)$$: $$(x+1)(x^2-x+1) = 0$$
$$x^3 + 1 = 0 \implies x^3 = -1$$
